comments.html:
I think another use case for a bare metal server would be to host some proprietary ivr system with a very old isa or pci card with some sort of onboard dsp. I find that even if you do pci passthru within vmware you lose a lot of features on that vm... like vmotion and resource ballooning.

Mario
comments.name: Mario

comments.html:
It's questionable whether it makes sense to mention "cloud" and "old ISA/PCI card" in the same sentence. Architecting a "bare-metal cloud instance support" around such a use case might be a marketing nirvana, but also technological stupidity.

I would keep that system in an isolated corner (quarantine seems to be a popular word these days) and connect it to my cloud via a L3 or (worst case) L2 gateway.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak
